title: I think everyone complaining about Annie should go play DotA2.
body:
Not in a 'get out of my game!' way, but just as a learning exercise. Are you finding that you get wrecked in teamfights by flash Annie ult? Then go play against Magnus or Enigma. You will learn, very quickly, how to avoid clumping up. They have longer AoE stuns, and with blink dagger, they can do it every time their stun is up, not just every time their stun is up and flash is up. 

No, you can't always survive a 1v1 if she burns flash, but she no longer has flash for the next couple of minutes, so get your jungler to gank, or just get really aggressive and rely on your flash to save you.

> [{quoted}](name=Elias1724,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HNTzgA3i,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-07-30T17:51:51.909+0000)
>
> What makes you think you can't learn that in LoL. Last hitting and positioning are just as key in LoL as they are in Dota.

LH are much harder in dota.  Almost no hero can use skills to farm creep waves at low lvls.  You actually have to right click down a creep.  If you are ranged you tend to have lower base dmg, allowing non ranged ppl to LH better.  The enemy team can deny you LH, so you are actually competing for LH not playing a farming game against the bot.

As for positioning, most ppl played unlocked cam, no free flash, not too many mobility kits, fog, invis, etc.  There are a lot more ways to die in dota, more lockdown and more ways to gank.  All of this makes positioning a lot harder since you get punished for being bad at it.

Have you played Dota 2?
Champion/hero attacks speeds are comparatively incredibly slow. 
Last hitting with ranged heroes is like playing an Annie to a Soraka - with the mages last hitting like Soraka and the shooters "ADC" shooting slightly fast than Annie. 
In other words, it's really fucking hard. It takes much more effort than in League. It certainly improved by last hitting in League of Legends after I played it.

MOBA players should generally try to learn Dota 2 first. It's the hardest MOBA I've played and it did help me get better at League. 
My favourites would be: 
Silencer because his kit is so troll.
Omniknight because he's a League of Legends Champion. (ez)
Phantom Lancer because his abilities are kewl.
Im not saying that Annie is OP, but in Dota2, Magnus and Enigma cant oneshot. Especially with carries in Dota being also most tanky heroes in their team.

Maybe they can't get a rampage by themselves, but Magnus can do a lot of damage with RP into Shockwave, AND he can then knock your entire team into his tower. And Enigma does a surprising amount of damage if he can Midnight Pulse first.

They should take away Tristana's line "Thanks for clumping" and give it to Annie; will make more sense on her. When she ults and hits all 5 enemy players have it so that they can all hear it. This way they will hopefully think "maybe if we don't stay so close together we can beat her."

Yea let's spice that argument with a different game. That should calm the people down.

It's not really a MOBA but has anyone heard of: **Savage 2: A Tortured Soul**?

I think it's a really good game. It mixes Warcraft III with First/Third Person HackNSlash/Shooting. 
Its commanding gameplay is far more basic than Warcraft III but its HackNSlash is solid with a variety of units with their abilities. 
You really feel like you are in war - with applies strategies, not some COD, sometimes.
I've had way better Epic Feels in Savage 2 than in League of Legends or any other game. 

Too bad it's main supporter S2 Games quit acknowledging it and its recent supporter S2Stony gave up trying to popularize it for over 3 years and now it's in essentially a coma state.
